Responsibilities

During the 16-week paid internship program you will be expected to work an average of 10 hours per week; you can work more or less each week depending on your course load. This projects aim is to create a web application that will allow users to leverage publicly available information by organizing and presenting the data in a more useful way than how it is currently made available. This internship is an integral part of our project and is centered on gathering and organizing the data that will form the backbone of our application. The project will be publicly available and can be used as part of your skills and experience portfolio for future employment. Roles & Responsibilities This position is responsible for: - Develop method for aggregating data from multiple public databases into one proprietary database - Develop method for automated continued update of the proprietary database - Develop methods for data cleaning and organization Depending on the progress that you make during the 16-week internship, additional tasks may be assigned: - Define data nodes to facilitate meaningful query - Develop a dashboard for visualization and/or query of the proprietary database Competency Requirements In order to perform the job successfully, the intern should demonstrate the following competencies: - Critical Thinking: Skilled at finding logical flaws in arguments and plans; identifies problems and solutions; provides detailed insight and constructive criticism - Displaying Technical Expertise: Effectively applies specialized knowledge and skills to perform work tasks; - Driving for Results: Aggressively pursues challenging goals and objectives; takes a highly focused, goal driven approach toward work; derives satisfaction from delivery of useable tools Minimum Qualifications (Experience and Skills) - Must be currently enrolled in BS, MS or PhD program - Experience with Microsoft Azure, Power BI, Elasticsearch and Kibana - Experience working on database, SQL - Familiarity with web application, html, css, javascript, PHP, etc although you will not be expected to create a web application - Familiarity with one or more general purpose programming language like R, python, C++, Matlab etc although you will not be expected to extensively use these skills - Familiarity with version control software like github Education Requirements Current student in Bachelors, Masters or PhD in Computer Science with an emphasis on Data Science Compensation Compensation will be an hourly rate for actual hours worked plus a bonus for delivery of a functional product. Work Environment This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment. The work may be completed off-site. Responsibilities

IT Help Desk Support is responsible for assisting users on various software related issues, and on rare occasion, hardware issues. This position will give the Intern the opportunity to learn and expand their skills supporting a complex Microsoft Windows-based systems with various productivity and vendor applications in an environment where the company is growing quickly. In addition to this day to day support, assistance with miscellaneous IT projects will be needed.

Requirements: - Respond to requests for technical assistance in person, remotely, via phone, and e-mail in a timely manner. - Diagnose (Troubleshoot) and resolve technical software issues, occasionally hardware issues. - Research questions using available information resources. - Advise users on appropriate actions. - Setup and configure workstations based on company needs and requirements. - Install and test computer software and associated hardware devices (i.e. Multi-Function Printers). - Perform miscellaneous in house IT tasks such as user account/phone setup, and software maintenance. - Miscellaneous projects based on skill and experience including web design, in house IT software and/or systems work, and/or other projects as need arises - Manage personal time schedule and report on regular basis on activity progress - Occasional After-Hours work required.

Skills: - Ideal candidate pursuing or having a degree in Computer Science or related technical field - Responsible and enthusiastic work ethic - Resourceful, well organized, highly dependable, efficient and detail oriented. - Strong verbal communication skills with personable relationship development skills with clear English speaking skills. - Ability to effectively communicate and work with others inside and outside the company, collaborate with others, and demonstrate high integrity - Previous experience with Adobe Acrobat X/XI/DC, and MS Office 2010/2013 Professional - Previous Helpdesk experience is a plus - Experienced with Windows 7 / Windows 10 in an Active Directory Domain environment - Light lifting and physical skills needed for equipment move/setup, shipping, etc.

The Software Development Internship position provides an opportunity for engineering students who are currently pursuing a computer science, computer engineering, or like engineering degree to get hands on experience working with engineers in a fast-paced software design and software quality assurance environment.

JOB DESCRIPTION

The software intern will contribute to development projects and advance best design practices.

Projects include RTOS systems, Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition Systems, along with uController firmware design.

Position exercises independent judgment within broadly defined practices and policies in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. Performs duties independently with only general direction given.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Provide engineering support related to product development projects including testing and design
Support a variety of software engineering activities and may be assigned to a variety of engineering tasks throughout the department
Be involved with many aspects of software quality assurance and some software design and analysis tasks
Provide feedback on specifications and designs
Learn about software engineering and instrumentation through daily activities.
Accept candid feedback and look for areas of improvements
Specific tasks will be tailored to the software interns experience level and abilities

Responsibilities

About this Job At Kuma Holdings LLC, we truly believe in reinventing systems and creative disruptive technologies. As a Mobile Engineer intern, you will be involved in building elegant products on world-class technologies that could potentially improve the lives of millions of people. You will play an important role in designing and developing features for our iOS app and web interface and be a part of product discussions from start to finish. We are looking for self-starting engineers with strong experience developing applications on the iPhone or iPad using the iOS SDK or other current software languages. If you are interested in being a part of a early stage disruptive technology that incorporates a blockchain tracking system, then we look forward to hearing from you. Responsibilities: Work closely with our product and design teams to create a unique customized experience for the iOS platform. Implement custom native user interfaces using the latest iOS programming techniques. Analyze and optimize UI & back-end application code for interfacing with our current platform. At the end of the internship, present to management and have option to continue full time Requirements: Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related field, or at least 3years completed towards a Bachelors degree, or full-time Masters degree student Object-oriented software development experience Experience building applications for iPhone or iPad Experience with multithreading programming Experience with Rest Web Services and JSON or simialar Experience writing unit tests and testable code Excellent problem solving, critical thinking and communications skills About Kuma Holdings LLC. Kuma Holdings is an incubator company focusing on disruptive consumer technologies.

Responsibilities

Wilson Elser is currently seeking a part-time Applications Development Intern to work a flexible schedule for the duration of the school year, with the potential to be extended into the summer, or a full time position. This paid internship is located at our Florham Park, New Jersey office located at 200 Campus Drive. This exciting internship will provide an opportunity for the qualified candidate to gain experience in a number of different aspects of working in an Application team environment such as Report Development, Operations Support, SQL development and Business Analysis. Wilson Elser will provide invaluable training, mentoring, and on the job experiential learning in a high paced, and dynamic environment. The Firm Wilson Elser is a full-service and leading defense litigation law firm who faithfully serves our clients with nearly 800 attorneys, across 36 offices in the United States and one in London. Founded in 1978, we rank among the top 200 law firms identified by The American Lawyer and are included in the top 50 of The National Law Journals survey of the nations largest law firms. The Position Qualifications - Actively pursuing a bachelors degree and will graduate between June 2019 and June 2020 - Computer Science or MIS Major required - Strong Microsoft Office knowledge - SQL skills are desirable - Strong written and verbal communications skills - Strategic and creative thinking Responsibilities - Learn skills such as coding, report development, testing, and applications support - Work with senior analysts and subject matter experts on various projects - Develop innovate solutions for issues or projects the team is working on - Assist in ongoing documentation of existing processes and other challenging projects Why Should You Apply? -Excellent Benefits -Generous PTO plan -Excellent growth and advancement opportunities -Corporate Discount Plans Interested? Wilson Elser is a firm who focuses our commitment to both our clients and you! Please consider joining our team by applying online or by sending your credentials to Careers@wilsonelser.com and putting "Florham Park Applications Intern" in the subject line. We are committed to cultivating an environment that embraces and promotes diversity as a fundamental value. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer; Minorities and Women are encouraged to apply.
